questions.Question: Do you usually go to bed and wake up at the same time?
How many hours do you usually sleep?
Do you regularly consume coffee or other drinks containing caffeine?
Which of the following do you do less than one hour before going to bed?
Options: Watching something on TV or your computer

tailorContent.text: You should really consider adapting a regular sleeping schedule. Only this way can your body get use to a rhythm which means you will fall asleep and wake up more easily.
A routine helps your body get use to a rhythm which means you will fall asleep and wake up more easily. You’re doing everything right!
Sleeping less than 5 hours on a regular basis is detrimental. You should try to get around 8 hours of sleep a night. By the way: sleeping it off on the weekend does not work.
Sleeping 5-7 hours is not enough. After only 10 days of 7 h your brain is as impaired as if you stayed up for 24 h straight. Aim for 8 hours to maintain full cognitive performance.
7 to 9 hours is the optimal amount of sleep for an adult. This helps you be at peak mental and physical performance. Keep it up!
As important as sleep is; sleeping over 9 hours regularly is not good for you either. Oversleeping brings many of the same dangers as sleep deprivation with it. Sleeping 7 to 9 hours is optimal

Caffeine helps your concentration and even increases your body's tolerance for pain. However it makes sleeping almost impossible. With a half-life-time of 3 to 5 hours caffeine stays in your body and keeps you from getting good sleep for far longer than you might expect. Avoid consuming caffeine after noon.

tailorContent.ans: Watching something on TV or your computer
tailorContent.text: Watching TV and being on your computer or phone is not a good idea. They are extremely stimulating for the bed and by that prevent winding down. They also emit blue light which puts your brain in “awake-mode”.
